title: Galactic Energy's Ceres-1 Reaches Orbit On First Sea Launch Mission
summary: China's Galactic Energy has successfully conducted their first sea launch, marking the company's ninth consecutive successful launch.

title: Ariane 6 One Step Closer, But Still No Launch Date
summary: Europe’s new Ariane 6 rocket is one step closer to launch today following a successful, if brief, engine test. A longer test is scheduled next month. Only then will European […]

title: Pentagon’s new plan to counter China includes swarms of smart satellites
summary: Under a new strategy to counter China’s military buildup, the Pentagon is advocating the use of low-cost autonomous platforms that can be mass produced and deployed at sea, on land, in the air and in space.

title: SDA Seeks Bids For 54 Hypersonic Missile-Tracking Satellites
summary: The Space Development Agency (SDA) has release a solicitation for the procurement of 54 satellites equipped with advanced infrared sensors.

title: US Space Force Unveils New Mission Statement
summary: The US Space Force in an effort to provide a clearer and more concise understanding of its mission has unveiled a new mission statement today. "Secure our nation's interests in, from, and to space"
